question_paper.question_paper_name: IIT M QUIZ 1 FOUNDATION DAD DIPLOMA QPD2 16 Oct 2022
question_paper.question_paper_description: 2022 Oct: IIT M QUIZ 1 FOUNDATION DAD

questions.question_text_1: Select which of the following are discrete data?
question_texts: Select which of the following are discrete data?

options.option_text: How many siblings do you have
Number of houses in your locality

questions.question_text_1: Select which of the following are continuous data?
question_texts: Select which of the following are continuous data?

options.option_text: Time between two successive failures of an equipment

questions.question_text_1: Select the scenario where a histogram will be an appropriate representation?
question_texts: Select the scenario where a histogram will be an appropriate representation?

questions.question_text_1: For a set of observations, the skewness = - 4. What does this indicate?
question_texts: For a set of observations, the skewness = - 4. What does this indicate?

options.option_text: Right tail is bigger than the left tail in the density plot
Left tail is bigger than the right tail in the density plot
Both the tails are bigger than normal
Both the tails are smaller than normal

questions.question_text_1: If the mean, mode, and median of a data set are not equal, what does that indicate?
question_texts: If the mean, mode, and median of a data set are not equal, what does that indicate?

options.option_text: Can’t say about symmetry with the information provided

questions.question_text_1: We have a dataset with a minimum value of 0.05 and a maximum value of 0.8. We are building an empirical distribution using the dataset. What is the probability (P) of finding the value 0.04 in the dataset?
question_texts: We have a dataset with a minimum value of 0.05 and a maximum value of 0.8. We are building an empirical distribution using the dataset. What is the probability (P) of finding the value 0.04 in the dataset?
Identify the misleading visual(s).

questions.question_text_1: For a normal distribution, the Coefficient of variation (CV) is greater than one. Is the statement True or False?
question_texts: For a normal distribution, the Coefficient of variation (CV) is greater than one. Is the statement True or False?

questions.question_text_1: P-P plot is only applicable for continuous distributions only and not for discrete distributions. Is the statement True or False?
question_texts: P-P plot is only applicable for continuous distributions only and not for discrete distributions. Is the statement True or False?

questions.question_text_1: In trace-driven simulation, there will not be sufficient data to run all possible simulations. Is the statement True or False?
question_texts: In trace-driven simulation, there will not be sufficient data to run all possible simulations. Is the statement True or False?

questions.question_text_1: You are given the following contingency table based on a sample data with two age groups and their brand preferences. You perform a chi-squared test of independence to make inferences about the population from this sample.

questions.question_text_1: At the significance level 0.05, chi-squared tabular value is 7.82. What do you conclude?
question_texts: At the significance level 0.05, chi-squared tabular value is 7.82. What do you conclude?

questions.question_text_1: Suppose a factory manufactures products on three machines A, B and C. Suppose 45% of total output comes from machine A, 25% of total output comes from machine B and 9% of total output comes from machine C. From the past data, it is known that 10% of products by machine A are defectives, 5% of products by machine B are defectives and 15% of products by machine C are defectives. What is the probability that the product has come from machine C given that it is a defective?  NOTE: Enter your answer in two decimal places.
question_texts: Suppose a factory manufactures products on three machines A, B and C. Suppose 45% of total output comes from machine A, 25% of total output comes from machine B and 9% of total output comes from machine C. From the past data, it is known that 10% of products by machine A are defectives, 5% of products by machine B are defectives and 15% of products by machine C are defectives. What is the probability that the product has come from machine C given that it is a defective?  NOTE: Enter your answer in two decimal places.
